main event: Two unidentified objects were observed in Charlestown, Indiana, on September 7, 1968.
interesting points: The observers described the lights as brighter than stars, moving erratically but staying close to each other., Unnamed relatives of the witnesses had also previously reported seeing similar lights around their farms., The sighting lasted about ten minutes, and the course of the objects was from ENE to WNW., Observers mentioned the possibility of the lights being confused with hot air balloons or stars, but they did not match typical star behavior., No physical evidence was found, leading to the conclusion of insufficient data for evaluation.
sighted object: two unidentified lights in the sky
witness description: Undergraduate college students with interest in scientific observation
